inn1.comm: full and swinging first ball, Dilshan went hard at it and got a thick outside edge that flew via a vacant gully down to third man
outswinger to Perera who is able to leave alone outside off
nips away and strikes the pad, pitched outside leg though
this is the one that comes back but it's too straight and this is what Perera brings, a delightful little flick off the pads is perfectly timed and finds the wide long leg rope
this is also what he brings, a hint of width and perfect timing to cut hard through cover point
tighter to off stump and fuller, left alone
back of a length just outside off, guided to point
this time more of a steer with a straight bat and gets it down to third man
a hint of width and cut without timing past point, Bell scrambles back to the fence and saves four
full at the pads, the ball deflects into the leg side and they get a quick leg bye
touch straight, clipped down to long leg
excellent yorker right on middle and off, well dug out
full at the stumps, tucked into square leg, Dilshan wants a single that's never there and is sent back, the throw hits the stumps and it ricochets past cover point for an overthrow
back of a length, tucked from the crease down to long leg
length ball blocked in the crease
a touch straight and allows Dilshan to push backward of square
firm drive from middle stump back down the ground but Anderson sticks out a boot and kicks it out to deep square leg! Lovely fielding, saved his side three runs
length ball nips back and strikes the pad too high for an appeal
full on the off stump and pushed calmly back to the bowler

only a touch back in length and pulled off the front foot over midwicket into the Mound Stand! There was a man back there but Perera got it in front of him and nailed it down the hill anyway, top shot
wider line, reached out for and gets it off the toe to third man
full and wide of off stump, Dilshan throws the kitchen sink at it and misses
length on leg stump, tucked to square leg and they immediately set off for a single, oh that was a sharp run and Bopara perhaps threw to the wrong end
full just outside off, pushed calmly to mid-off
full at the pads, it deflects into the leg side and Dilshan is sent back looking for a leg bye and has to dive back into his ground with Bopara diving in for the throw, he missed the stumps
driven off low on the bat to cover from just outside off
driven again without timing on the bounce to Bell at cover
forward press just blocking this time back to the bowler
driven without timing once more to mid-off
more lavishly struck at this time but again no timing and finds mid-off, a sign of Dilshan's waning power perhaps?

back of a length, two feet outside off, Perera goes to pull and is late on the stroke, getting a toe-end to Jordan at slip who takes a nice catch, big wicket for England that. Funny dismissal, Perera deciding too late to pull, didn't get in the right position to do so and got a thick edge that went low to Jordan's left, he dived and took a smart catch
a foot outside off and left alone
similar line, left again
bumper, well-directed, ducked under
forced off the back foot and gets a thick edge on the bounce to Tredwell at second slip who gets down very well with his left hand to save probably a couple
back of a length but a tighter line and left alone
full just outside off, pressed into the covers
bumper and Dilshan is quickly onto it, playing a nice hook over square leg for a one-bounce four
back on a full length around off stump, forward block to the bowler
length ball that Dilshan is able to turn wide of long leg for a couple
full on the stumps, tucked up towards mid-on and they take on the fielder, Root's throw was miles off
full on the stumps, clipped to square midwicket
full just outside off, yet another mistimed drive to cover
tighter line, Dilshan goes to turn to leg and gets struck on the pad which runs to point
forward press on the stumps, gets a thick inside edge to square leg
good length on off, blocked into the covers
full on leg stump, goes to flick leg side but gets another inside edge and it runs to the fielder
aiming to leg, gets struck on the thigh guard and it runs wide of gully for a leg bye
length on the stumps, tucked to short midwicket
another block coming forward
Dilshan goes for his very own Dilscoop and gets it head tucked down and lifts straight over the keeper
and again, touch straighter line and gets it fine of long leg, better stroke that
tries another scoop, Anderson went shorter, much more difficult to scoop that and Dilshan misses

back of a length, Dilshan goes to leave it, it comes off the glove and loops over the keeper, agonising for Anderson, lucky for Dilshan, it came back down the slope and took a big glove out of the reach of Buttler
full on the off stump, blocked coming forward
touch wider, angled off the back foot to backward point
full on the stumps, driven back down the ground and the bowler saves well to keep Sangakkara on naught
full on the off stump, just blocked now
slower ball, Sangakkara tries to pull and gets it off the pad to the keeper
big bumper, too big and wided
full length and blocked, Sangakkara still to get off the mark
around the wicket, back of a length and cut to point
fuller and pushed down to long-on
slip goes in, length ball tucked around the corner and finally Sangakkara is off the mark
forward on the stumps, tucked wide of the leg side 45 for a quick single
fuller on middle and leg and tucked behind square on the leg side for an easy run
back and cut from off stump, gets it wide of point but Tredwell scrambles well and saves with a left hand
full at the pads, it deflects behind square on the leg side, Dilshan slips but makes the run easily
short and wide but only toe-ended to cover, batsman missed out
lets this come to him and guides it down to third man
leg side wide
forward on off stump, pushed firmly down to mid-on
full but a touch straight and clipped out to deep-square leg
forward just outside off stump to a full ball, dropped towards mid-off, they consider a single but turn it down
full length that Dilshan tries to advance to, can only force it to short midwicket
better advance and clipped to long-on
full on leg stump, clipped to short midwicket
outside off, tucked down to long-off
tries to turn it around the corner but gets struck on the pad
this is flicked well out to deep square leg
full on middle and leg, whipped out to deep square leg
advance down the wicket, tries to slap a length ball leg side but mistimes it and Cook gets down well to save at mid-on
good length just outside off, calmly blocked in the crease
bumper and a wide called
down the track and slapped over extra cover, no timing so it plugs and it's just a couple
length on the stumps, pushed out through midwicket and they get an easy single to the man in the deep
length on the stumps, flicked down to long leg
back and forced into the gap at over
tossed onto off stump, firm push to extra cover
shimmy down the wicket and pressed down to long-off
whoops, a high full toss, Dilshan pulls it hard to leg but can only find deep square leg
back to cut off the stumps and finds cover
touch short, back and clipped out to deep square leg
good length on the stumps, tucked out to deep square leg
back of a length and helped down to long leg
leg side tuck for one, too many of these available off Jordan's bowling so far
helped down the leg side again and this time Sangakkara gets it fine of long leg and gets four, poor ball really
another knock-down into the leg side and an easy run through square leg, fifty stand here in 67 balls
bit of width outside off now and a cut down to third man
full and blocked up the wicket
a little turn beats the attempted push to leg
down the wicket and flicking back to Tredwell
trying to find the straight fielders again but can only bounce it back to the bowler
this time gets right to the pitch of the ball and works it down to long-on
around the wicket, back on his stumps, dropped into the covers
flat around the wicket and it skids past the attempted cut stroke
fuller and pushed down to long-off
down the wicket and whacked down the ground, perhaps a half-chance to the bowler but that's probably being mean, it went straight as a dye for four
down the track and lifts this over mid-on, only just, but four more, better from Sangakkara
now plays a gorgeous cover drive that's threaded through with great timing, beautiful stroke
back and tucking this out to deep midwicket
around the wicket, tossed up nice and slow, Sangakkara pushes it away from the crease
flatter trajectory, leans into a gentle stroke to mid-off
straighter line, gets a bit of dip around middle and leg, Sanga punches back to the bowler
Sangakkara tries to use his feet again, gets to the pitch but finds Tredwell again
tossed up outside off, tapped into the covers
super hands and footwork, though not so impressive from Ballance at mid-on, mistiming his dive... Sangakkara skipped out and whipped the ball back past Tredwell, firmly struck for another boundary
on the stumps, Dilshan goes across and nurdles one behind square
length ball outside the line of off, tapped watchfully into the off side
slightly fuller, tailing away as Sanga comes forward and pushes one to mid-off
angling in from outside off, worked to leg but can't get it through
pitched up a touch straighter, clipped down the track, Bopara can't get his hand to it but mid-on keeps them to one
here's the four ball, full and wide and Sanga is loose as a goose now, isn't going to miss out, leans into a chocolate-box cover drive that gives the sweeper no chance
floated up outside off, dips a little and Dilshan taps to leg
flighted, comes forward and tickles a single to long-on
around the wicket, ever-so-slightly short, cut off the back foot through point for a couple
fuller, Sangakkara presses forward and then rocks back to place an even more impressive shot past the diving backward point for a couple more
tossed up outside off, punched towards extra cover on the front foot
worked back to mid-on, who's a bit deep and Sanga is comfortably in for one more
goes around the wicket, slightly full on the stumps and glanced through square
good length, in the channel outside off, steers straight to the man at point
full and tailing in towards the stumps, pushed to mid-on and they can take a single
on the pads and this is imperiously scotched through midwicket, lovely timing and it races away for four more
taps one towards mid-off and there's one more there
slightly full and straight, Dilshan is on the move and on-drives, the bat turned in the hands slightly but it still beats the dive of mid-on - Dillers goes back ahead in the scoring
tossed up outside off, Sanga punches back to the bowlerr
picks a gap in the covers for one to the sweeper
full and flighted on the stumps, Dilshan uses the feet and works one to long-on
tossed up, easy for Sangakkara to take one more to the deep cover fielder
ooh, done him, quicker ball and it goes straight on, gets a leading edge that pops short on the off side
skips forward but bunts the ball into the ground and Tredwell gets a hand to it
starts down the leg side, another wide
full and leg-stump-ish, clipped unfussily through square, just one but that's enough for a raised bat - a half-century in his 350th ODI innings
gets forward and dabs a single into the covers, fifty up for Dilshan, too - and that's the century stand, as well. With both batsmen on 50, that is a very neat 100
too much width, Sangakkara flays the ball behind square, all wrists and timing, four more to King Kumar
straighter line, can't get this one away off the legs
pitched up outside off, the bat carves a sweeping arc but this isn't middled, just one into the covers
tighter from Jordan, back of a length and angling in from outside off, Dilshan plays it with a straight bat
full and pitching around off stump, gets forward and drives one down the ground
tossed up and Dilshan uses the feet, closes the bat face to work a single to long-on
around the wicket to Sanga, shorter length and he defends from the crease
floated up, skips out and punches one more back past the bowler
goes on with the arm outside off, Dilshan presses forward and steers to point
slow and loopy wide of the stumps, the batsman gets forward but miscues short on the leg side
good length, middle and leg stump, dabbed short to the on side
angled across the lefty, who opens the face and runs the ball to point on the bounce
another dot ball, in-between length and Sangakkara punches to extra cover
shorter, on the hips and tucked away for a single
a direct hit from Cook at mid-on but Dilshan's desperate slide had carried him well over the line... Cook was a little deep and Dilshan judged it well enough
touch short and outside the line of off, opens the face and runs one to third man
good length around off, tapped from the crease to extra cover
tossed up a little higher, outside off, plants the front foot and drives one to the sweeper
floated up on the stumps, driven back firmly but Tredwell throws himself to his right to make the save
nudges one off the pads through square leg
flatter, bit of width and Sanga beats point with a back-foot chop
flighted around off stump, turn of the wrists and that's one more through midwicket
gets forward to a full ball and finds mid-off with the drive
outside the line of off, Dilshan tries an extravagant scoop but he judges the pace wrong and is hit on the gloves, dropping safe down on to the pitch
full and punched back, Bopara gets fingertips on it but there's one more
edged... but wide of Buttler, who is up to the stumps, and that runs away to the boundary. Thick chunk of bat on that, as Sanga drove down the wrong line, needed a slip in to take that
on the stumps, dabbed back past the bowler
Dilshan comes forward, can't get his drive away
maybe they're not just happy to take the ones and twos, Sanga now scalps Tredwell with a lofted drive down the ground, straight over the bowler's head, shooper shtuff
slower delivery, on the stumps, worked off the legs
flatter, grips a little and turned to leg
nudges off the pads into a gap this time
tossed up around off stump, Sanga steps out and flicks one more through square
little quicker and straighter, Dilshan closes the face and works one more to the leg side
pitched up and Dilshan picks out cover coming forwards
very full and tailing in towards off, driven on the full through the covers
leg-stump line, Sanga uses the feet but can't squeeze the ball past midwicket
fullish, outside off, done on one knee to push one between extra cover and mid-off
pitched up in the channel wide of the stumps, Dilshan opens the face and steers one more to third man
that's poor, a leg-side wide, beats Sanga's attempted flick and Buttler can't get to it either, that will be five extras
and Sangakkara rubs some salted caramel into the wound, a sweetly struck chip over mid-off, doesn't quite go all the way but he is bossing proceedings
tossed up around middle and off, Dilshan squirrels away another down the ground
floated up around off stump, presses forward the block
superb work from Sanga, uses the feet to narrow the gap and then clatters four through midwicket, not much turn to worry about but he calculated his angles brilliantly
flatter and quicker, perhaps, clips the outside edge and runs to short third man
pushed through, maybe turning in a fraction, hits Dilshan on the pad but outside the line
can't get this one away either
slightly back of a length, chopped past point but there's a sweeper to clean up
back of a length, waits and runs one to third man
on the stumps, tighter lines from Anderson, works one to leg
on the stumps, Dilshan nudges this around the corner for one more
on the stumps, Sanga glances one through backward square leg
fuller and otuside off, presses forward and dabs a single through the covers
tossed up, comes forward and taps one to long-on
around the wicket to Sanga, little bit of width but the cut is straight to point
rocks back and this time forces the ball through with a chop of the wrists
tossed up, punched back down the track but Tredwell stops it
plays back down the track but Tredwell grabs the ball again
more evident force in this stroke, as Dilshan whirls the bat through a punch to long-on for one
full and straightening a little outside off, Dilshan taps into the covers half forward
back of a length and over the top of off, shows it a deferential straight bat in defence
short of a length and angling back a touch, again blocked from the crease
that's a beaut from Anderson, too good for Dilshan in this touch, nips past the bat as he dangles his bat in the wind
fuller, uses the feet this time and clubs a cross-batted stroke through the covers
on the pads and Sanga coolly tickles one more behind square

clipped back on the on side and Root and Dilshan have go into a bit of a tangle... Root dived for the ball, seemed to land on Dilshan's back leg, looks pretty awkward on the replay; the result was Dilshan tumbling back over Root and both plays lying in a heap. Maybe a slightly twisted ankle for Dilshan, which isn't going to aid his progress any, there's a short break as he gets some strapping applied
touch wide, cracked off the back foot and this flies out of the middle, maybe Dilshan has rediscovered his vim, takes a brilliant stop from Ballance to prevent a boundary
lovely work from Sanga, gets forward and the whistles a flicked drive through midwicket for another boundary
skips out again and works a couple into a gap at midwicket
pushed through, again on the walk and glances one more through midwicket
on the stumps, calmly clipped through square
Dilshan attempts to scoop a length ball outside off, doesn't get close to connecting
back to basics now, shovelling wide of mid-on, this was like truncheon aimed at a miscreant, clunky connection but it raced past the diving Cook

full and straight and bowled him! Dilshan had got across his stumps and attempted to ramp the ball to fine leg - though there was a fielder there - missed again and the ball flicked the back pad before removing leg stump
full of a length outside off and Jayawardene accepts the challenge straight away, steering a drive past backward point
on the stumps, worked into the leg side - good over from Anderson but England still have some work to do to pull things back
length ball, nibbles back and hits high up the bat as Jayawardene comes forwards
off-stump line, presents a straight bat in defence
Jayawardene uses the wrists to flick a length ball from around off stump through backward square, nicely played
pitched up around middle and leg, Sanga glances through square leg, there's a man protecting that boundary
good length, over the top of middle and off, Jayawardene mistimes a dab to leg, midwicket comes in to collect
line and length in the corridor, met with a solid forward defensive - just two singles off the over
back of a length just outside off, dabbed to backward point
good length on the stumps, dropped into the covers and they get a sharp run
backs away and tries to play off side, misses a length ball that goes over middle and off stumps
connects with this cut but finds point
fuller and driven in the air but just short of a diving Morgan at point
back of a length, Jayawardene opens the face and guides this to slip
back of a length, pulled wide of deep midwicket and this will be the century, they trot back for the second and Sangakkara's brings up his first century at Lord's in any format, a great-paced innings
full and wide, Sangakkara gave himself room so has to reach for this and gets a thick outside edge to third man
full length, Jayawardene aims leg side with a big swing and misses completely, it bounced a little on him
gives himself room to the leg side, Jordan followed him and sent it further down leg where Buttler claimed a fine catch
length ball and picked up over midwicket for a one-bounce four, clears the front leg and this is whacked almost for six
fuller and clipped into the deep again, nearly finds the man at deep-square leg
tight leg stump line, turned down to long leg for a single
full on the stumps and a gorgeous clean strike sends the ball sailing down the ground for a couple bounces four
turned to leg this time, timed well but Jordan does well at deep midwicket to save four

length just outside off, Jayawardene tries to clear mid-off and doesn't, easy catch for Anderson down at knee height. Jayawardene didn't get going at all and this was totally mistimed, off high on the bat I think and looped it straight to Anderson
cry for lbw as this strikes the pad with Mathews aiming leg side, pitched outside leg
length on off stump, blocked in the crease
length just outside off, Mathews drives from the crease without moving his feet and gets a bottom edge that bounces and loops so narrowly overt the stumps, millimetres away
around the wicket onto off stump, easy push to long-off
low full toss just outside off, slapped back to the bowler
full outside leg, clipped out to deep-square leg
down the track and opens up the off side, but can't thread it past extra-cover but they took a run on his diving save
back and flicking to leg, gets an edge into the pad that runs up the wicket
a big heave to leg on one knee, decent connection but straight to deep midwicket
too short and slapped hard past extra-cover, Gurney is annoyed with himself and rightly so, that was a poor ball
back and cut hard, finds backward point
slower ball but much too wide and allows Mathews to swing through it, he nails it over extra-cover, no sweeper out on the off side
low full toss on the leg stump, tucked out to one of three players out on the leg side
full on the stumps, Sangakkara opens up the off side and drives in the air wide of long-off for a couple
yorker-length but Sangakkara managed to steer it square and almost managed to evade backward point

floated up, draws Sangakkara down the wicket, he doesn't get to the pitch of the ball, swings to the off side, misses and Buttler whips off the bails for a very easy stumping. Nice bit of bowling from Tredwell and ends a super innings that has put Sri Lanka in a very nice position
forward and presses to extra cover
forward again, dribbles this into the covers but no run available
held back a touch by Tredwell, driven in the air but well short of backward point
straighter line, back on his stumps and drops this into the on side
over the wicket, full just outside off, knocked back to the bowler
full just outside off, driven hard out to the Grandstand rope where deep cover fields
full and well down leg, good take from Buttler
step to leg, Jordan bangs it in short and a cross-batted slap sends the ball off the toe only back to the bowler
fired down the leg side for another wide, the 12th of the innings
low full toss, slapped to mid-on
leg side wide yet again, that's Jordan's seventh
another low full toss, tried to be swung down the ground but mistimed and Jordan fields
yorker following the batsman to leg, dug out back to the bowler
short and slapped just over extra-cover, it skips down the hill and it takes a diving Anderson to save four
full length and a full swing of the bat makes a nice strike towards long-off for four, clean strike that
leg side delivery but Anderson has flicked the bowler's stumps so it's a no-ball, he's hurt his hand here too, blood has appeared
decent yorker, dug out to extra cover
length ball, held back a touch, played off the back foot out to deep midwicket
low full toss, pressed to extra cover and they take on the fielder and get home easily
knee-high full toss this time, Thirimanne can only clip it out to deep square leg for a single
Mathews gives himself room, Anderson follows him to leg, Mathews taps it up on the leg side and they take a run
low full toss, clipped out to long-on
full just outside off and once again Thirimanne is able to free his arms and carves this over extra-cover, no-one out at deep cover so this is four
fuller length and Thirimanne can only dab it down in front of point for a single
short and tucked down to long leg with a little paddle pull
Thirimanne lifts this leg side this time, decent connection but not timed well enough to reach the long-on rope
yorker, dug out and finds it's way to long leg
low full toss, whipped off the stumps to deep square leg

short, slower-ball, pulled without timing and Ballance swoops at short long leg to take the catch or has he? The fielder is unsure so we go upstairs and the replays almost always rule out these catches even if they look fine to the naked eye. It would appear Ballance got a right-hand under this, although it was a bit of a messy take. I reckon he's got this but will the third umpire be able to tell conclusively? Perhaps not. But whatdoyaknow, he's given it out! Important wicket because Thirimanne was striking it quite nicely
back of a length, guided wide of third man, they run hard and come back for two and get home courtesy of a wide throw from Ballance, hero to zero
out to Ballance again, this driven from a low full toss, no chance for Ballance to save two there
tucked leg side this time out to deep square leg
good yorker, dug out up the wicket and it evades the bowler
low full toss clipped out to deep midwicket
full but leg side, England hand over another run and more extra balls, 2.2 overs coughed up as it stands
excellent yorker, dug out into the covers and they still take one
knee-high full toss, slapped without timing back to the bowler
slower ball and short, Mathews sees it, steps inside it and whacks it over square leg to the Grandstand fence
gets down for the paddle sweep, meets this on the full and steers it to the Warner Stand rope
another full toss but gets away with it just push to extra-cover

step to leg, Jordan follows him, Mathews is cramped and tries to swing over the leg side, totally miscues it straight up in the air and Anderson pouches the catch taking a couple of steps back at mid-on. Handy little innings from Mathews, without the explosion that Sri Lanka required for a really intimidating total
length ball, Priyanjan steps away and swing off side, getting a thick outside edge that almost carries to third man, lands a yard or two in front of him
Kulasekara's turn to step to leg, Jordan goes short, batsman tries to cut it and gets a bottom edge almost into his stumps that runs to Buttler
excellent yorker and knocks out leg stump. Kulasekara nowhere near it, he stepped to leg again, Jordan fired it right in at the stumps and cannoned the base of leg, England continue to take wickets
bumper but it's too big and another wide, chalk up No. 15
wow what a strike, full length on the stumps and Senanayake swings it into the pavilion! A huge smash, clean as a whistle, right out of the screws
low full toss taken to deep midwicket
low full toss, driven out to long-on
full at the stumps, this is swung leg side and away from mid-on for a couple
full and down the leg side, for a you-know-what

another low full toss and swung hard at but gets a wild outside edge that goes high but not long enough and Morgan takes the catch running back a few yards from point, a solid catch taken easily in the end, total miscue from the batsman
full toss at above knee height, swung over midwicket and finds the Grandstand fence
another full toss but this is another miscued swing aiming down the ground, off high on the bat, and straight to Cook coming in at mid-on who claims a solid catch
full outside off, reached out for and managed to carve it wide of short third man and that brings up the 300, a great way to end the innings

inn2.comm: length on leg stump, comes off the pad to square leg and they get a leg bye to get the chase underway
a cutter, 76mph, outside off, chopped down to third man
full and wide outside off, left alone
length delivery, waited for in the crease, dabbed towards point
fuller length and straighter, pushed to mid-on
straight delivery and Cook rather plays across it but tucks it down to long leg

full and swinging into off stump, huge cry for lbw, not out given but Sri Lanka go for the review. I thought Cook got an inside edge into his front pad but the replay suggests not but he might have squeezed it, can the third umpire be sure that was pad first? He's gone to Hawk Eye and it's striking Cook in line and going on to hit off stump, so it's overturned and Cook falls lbw to a superb first nut from Malinga
wider line and Ballance able to leave alone
back on off stump and Ballance gets his pad out of the way and blocks it up the wicket
length delivery, blocked coming forward just about
full and swinging in again, Ballance again makes sure the front pad isn't in the way and nudged it back up the wicket
around the wicket, speared in full and straight, blocked
full on off stump, played forward and blocked into the covers
drops the length back slightly and Bell stays in the crease to defend
glorious cover drive, classic Bell, sweet as a nut past extra cover
fine response, gets the length right and floats one past the outside edge
wide enough to leave alone this time
Bell comes right out to meet this and ease it past mid-off for a gentle couple
stays around the wicket, but too straight and this drifts down the leg side via the pad but Sangakkara makes a fine diving save

full just outside off stump, Bell plays forward, tries to pull the bat inside it but can't and edges to slip. Malinga creating indecision and it does for Bell, thick enough edge that carries low to first slip, solid catch. Bell could have left it, surprising error considering his confident start
full length but Root - as is his won't - plays back and blocks in the crease, it was also wide enough to leave alone
fuller and Root sort of comes forward to this, leaves alone a ball a foot wide of off stump
wider line and more comfortable to leave alone
full on the off stump, Root is perilously hanging back again and just keeps it out into the covers, living dangerously there, come forward man! Malinga is all over him

full delivery just outside off, Ballance comes forward and there's a huge cry for caught behind an he's given out! But Ballance reviews. Hot Spot has no mark on the bat but a mark on the pad and Real Time Snicko has a sound when the bat passes the pad but not the bat and on that evidence, the decision is overturned so two good reviews so far in this innings
this swings down leg and takes something to evade Sangakarra's dive, it was a brush of the pad
wide enough to leave alone outside off stump
forward and dropped into midwicket, Root considered a single but was sent back, rightly so
wide enough to leave alone outside off
too full and that's a lovely straight drive, sweetly timed past mid-off
full and swinging from leg stump, Root looked to play to leg and got square up and got an edge that saved him from lbw and it didn't carry to second slip
ROOT COMES FORWARD!! and blocks on off stump to cover
forward again! What has got over him! Tucks it into the covers once more
and another one! Woaha Rooty! Another forward defence
he's getting the hang of this is Root, props forward yet again to defend up on the off side
fuller delivery and this is driven at, off a thick outside edge to third man
a touch easier to come forward to Kulasekara and Root blocks into the covers again, you can leave that line though, no need to play
tries to come down the track here, ends up flicking a wider ball down to third man
good length on off stump, played from the crease to extra-cover, finds a gap and they take a run
length ball wide enough to dabble at and guides it down to third man
this time Ballance can open the face and take a single to third man
forward defence back to the bowler
short and pulled, not in total control and it lands a couple of yards short and to the right of long leg

what's happened here, Malinga has produced a great yorker to knock out leg stump but there's no reaction from anybody! Turns out it was a free hit, with the last delivery a no-ball! Everyone was in the dark about that it seemed!
another great yorker, this is nicely dug out
slower ball on off stump, full, Ballance gets down to it and tucks it to point
too full outside off and Ballance leans into a handsome drive through cover point, excellent timing
good length on middle and leg, this is tucked to midwicket
touch more leg side and turned to square leg
forward and blocking just outside off, cry for lbw but I'm sure he was outside the line, edge too
forward on off stump, knocked into the covers
touch short and Root sits back and cracks it past point, well put away
forward and gets a thick inside edge down to long leg from off stump
good length just outside off, played from the crease and dropped into the covers
waited for and forced backward of point but not wide enough of third man for a second
wide enough to leave alone outside off
goes to cut and gets a bottom edge to slip on the bounce
shorter length, played off the back foot to the bowler
length ball, comes up off the thigh pad and pops up into the leg side, short of square leg
fuller length. played from the crease, bit of inswing beats the inside edge and causes an appeal but not out
full and wide of off stump, left alone
around the wicket, swept to short fine leg for one
woof, how has that missed! A beauty from Senanayake and that has flummoxed Ballance, turned just enough to beat the bat but bounced over off stump
drops a little short and wide, stays back and cuts one away, think about two but decide better
tossed up and punched into the covers
carrom ball from Senanayake, worked through the leg side
floats this up on the stumps and Ballance sweeps through midwicket
leg-stump line and pushed back into the on side
short ball, pulled aerially through square leg, clothed it but drops safely
heads in hands again, Root getting an inside edge on to his front pad and it skips away behind square
Mathews gives a bit of width and Ballance drops back, cracks a cut stroke, excellent diving stop at backward point
wicket to wicket from Mathews, squirted to leg and they scamper back for a second
length ball, tapped back on the leg side
tossed up on the stumps, gently worked into a gap on the leg side
plenty of air, slow delivery and turned into the leg side for one more
outside off, Ballance leans out and punches through the covers
full, dipping on leg stump, Root turns it into a full toss and flicks behind square
on the stumps, nudged off the pads for a single to the midwicket area
length ball, Root flicks off the hips, straight to Jayawardene but it bamboozles him and they get one more
around off stump, steered to point
on the stumps, worked through backward square leg - that's England 50 up. They're a sixth of the way there!

holy moly, this could have been out at both ends but England survive a running mix-up! Ballance cut into the ground towards backward point, where Dilshan swooped on it, the batsmen hesitated and Root would have been short... but so would Ballance, as he changed his mind and tried to regain his ground; the throw missed and Mathews had to scramble after it in his follow through as Ballance belatedly raced up to the other end
works the ball off his body through midwicket
in the channel outside off, lets this one go
angled across the left-hander, who cuts into the ground and backward point fields
turned to the fielder square on the leg side
tossed up very fill outside off, comes forward and taps down the ground
tossed up, worked past mid-on for a single
comes forward and pushes one more down the ground
full and flighted outside off, Ballance pierces the off side ring with a drive, exercising the cover boundary rider
pushed through outside off, leans back a cuts one away square
full and outside off, Ballance punches one through the covers
gets across and defends a length ball on off stump
length on the stumps, tries to play across the line, hit high on the pads
tip and run into the off side, they get one comfortably - that's the 50 stand, the rate steady rather than spectacular

good cricket all round here, Ballance dabs a late cut down towards third man, he plays it very fine but Nuwan Kulasekara hurtles after it, dives, stops and makes the return throw with enough rapidity to limit the batsmen to just two runs
digs this in short, little quicker than Mathews' stock ball, left alone outside off
pushed into the off side
floated up outside off stump from around the wicket, picks a gap at deep extra cover
straighter line, taps one more to long-on
tossed up outside off and Ballance's mistimed drive doesn't pierce the ring
flatter, touch short outside off, Ballance cuts into the ground towards backward point
nudged around the corner, short fine leg doesn't collect cleanly
pushed through outside off, driven along the ground for a couple into the deep
on the stumps, turned towards midwicket
not much turn to speak of, whether Mendis is looking for it or not, worked behind square off the pads
tossed up, punched down the ground to long-on
full, on the stumps, pushed back past the bowler but mid-off is up
tossed up on middle and leg, dabs a single down the ground to long-on
offbreak from around the wicket, punched trough the covers coming forwards
on the stumps, gets forward and tickles one to long-on
bit of width, goes back and slaps a cut shot in front of square, can't beat the cover man
tossed up and driven through the off side for one
gets out on the front foot, slides a lap shot to short third man
gets forward, crashes the ball through the off side to the sweeper
on the stumps, worked short on the leg side
leans out to drive, plays this in front of the cover sweeper and they get a couple
pushed off the leg behind square on the leg side, they amble one
pushed through flatter and quicker, Root drops his bat on it
outside off, skids off and steered to into the gully, another single
flat trajectory on the stumps, turned to leg
tossed up outside off, pushed into the covers coming forwards
nicely played, waits for a fullish ball angled across and steers behind deep point for a couple
tossed up and pushed into a gap in the covers
takes another single off the pads
full and on the stumps, swept through backward square
gives this some air, dips around off stump, Ballance drives and Priyanjan collects
turned off the legs short of midwicket
half an appeal as the ball skids past the bat outside off, Sanga nudges off the bails just to be sure
pushed down the ground to long-on
steered wide of cover, there's a moment's hesitation but the collect wasn't sharp enough to trouble them
pushed through outside off, Root dabs to cover
in the channel, skids on and this time he picks a gap in front of square
taps one through the off side
uses the feet, Ballance is well down the wicket but drives flat through the covers for one
on the stumps, can't get this away
fullish ball outside off, Root reverses the hands and gets this away fine past short third man, neatly done
flighted on the stumps, sweeps this in orthodox fashion to backward square
slightly short, Ballance plugs straight to cover along the ground
flicked out in the channel, Root waits and steers one behind square

attempts the reverse sweep, there's a sliver of top edge as the ball bounces through to Sangakkara and up goes the finger! Mendis rolled this out from over the wicket, across the left-hander, it was maybe a little quicker on him, a thin edge, maybe straight off the face of the bat and into the keeper's gloves
Morgan is jinking about in the crease straight away, flicks a couple fine on the leg side to get going
this goes through a little low outside off, defended
pushed through around middle and off, Morgan blocks
goes for a little ramp shot again, flicks over Sangakkara, just enough on it and slip has to go chasing after the ball
tossed up and punched back to the bowler
floated up wide of the stumps, Root comes froward and drives to cover
pushed through flat on the stumps, Root clips off his pads through square
tossed up, goes on towards leg stump, hit on the pad but heading down
floated up on leg stump, tapped back
makes a bit of room and carves this through the covers, the boundary rider has some work to do but cuts it off
on the stumps, tapped into the off side
skidding on, fullish and Root blocks it down on to the pitch
floated up a little higher, flicked towards midwicket
pitching on middle and off, dabbed into the covers and they take one
this is practically wicket to wicket from Mendia, Morgan clips through square
gets forward and knocks one more through the covers
tossed up, punches one down the ground
offbreak pitching in line with off, Morgan skips out and the smothers in defence
attempts the reverse sweep, doesn't get any bat on it, Sangakkara collects down the leg side
is that an edge? Yes, I think it was, trying a late cut and it cannoned into the tips of Sangakkara's gloves, no chance really
on the stumps, worked to leg
gets forward and drills one through the off side, between deep cover and long-off
slightly short, pulled flat through square leg to the man in the deep

plays across the line and a top edge flies to fine leg! Root falls in the 40s attempting to give Mathews the hurry up, maybe just stopped a little in the pitch and it ballooned off the bat, a simple catch for the man down there
dug in down the leg side, wild swing and a miss from Morgan, half and appeal from Sanga - wide
back of a length and down the leg side, nudged through square leg
bangs this in outside off, rides the bounce and taps square
gets across his stumps and plays back to the bowler
beaten outside off, teasing line and length and Bopara is drawn into a flirt
floated up wide of the wicket, reaches out to drive, gets it through for a couple

beats the bat as Morgan advances again... and that's a simple stumping! Senanayake has done England's prizefighter again, he hadn't looked comfortable and this time he raced out, took a wild swipe and left Sangakkara with plenty of time to nudge off the bails. The back foot was some way from getting back
floated up outside off, tapped back
pushed through outside the line of off, Buttler has a nervy swish and misses
gets forward and pushes one down the ground
good footwork from Bopara, strolls down the pitch and clips on to long-on
stays in the crease and steers square on the off side, they get a couple
comes forward, drives this with an open face, again picks the gap and hard running brings another brace
short of a length outside off, lets this one through
short again, outside off and Bopara runs this off the face down to third man
bumper, over the stumps and over the crouching Buttler
fullish outside off, may have been cross seam, Buttler watches it through... the required rate above nine now
full on the stumps, calmly played down to long-on
21.4 overs without a boundary - until now! Reverse sweep nailed past backward point and the fans go wild!
conventional sweep this time, just a dab behind short long leg for a single
played forward and dropped into the leg side
firm straight drive inside mid-off for a quick single
forward and pushed back up the wicket
delicate turn around the corner and they can come back for a second
back foot and flicked down to long-off
Buttler also hanging back and punching down the ground, this to long-on
goes to sweep a very full ball and gets hit outside the line of off stump, it ricochets to the left of short third man for single
back and pushing to mid-off, they take on the fielder and get home easier

swept and missed, appeal for lbw, not out given the umpires though there was bat involved, it runs fine and they sprint hard for a third but Sri Lanka want to go upstairs but they're not going to be allowed to because it was too long after the decision. Can't think why, they could hardly turn around while the ball was live and call for a review
length just outside off, forward and dropped into the covers
overpitched, glorious cover drive beats the cover sweeper, perfect timing
across his stumps to scoop and does so, getting a little flick from outside off that just gets past Sangakkara
full and dabbled down the ground for an easy single
a step down the wicket but just blocking a length ball just outside off
a step down the wicket and firmly driven with an open face wide of mid-off, it was in the air for a time but comfortably in the gap
another drive, this along the ground to extra-cover
step down the wicket, bowler goes shorter, Buttler taps it to midwicket
full delivery and room to swing outside off, Buttler goes up and over extra-cover, another lovely strike, great timing
full on the stumps, flicked down to long-on
Bopara tries the aerial route too and doesn't get hold of it, so much so that it lands short of mid-off, good job he hit it so badly
back and tucked to midwicket
this time finds the leg side gap and they get one through square leg
forward and dropped into square leg again for an easy single
in the crease but just blocking this on the off stump
low full toss but only steered to midwicket
wide outside off, poor ball with third man up and Buttler steers it past him
length on the stumps, flicked down to long leg
steered behind square leg and they run hard for two as the sweeper runs around
bumper and ducked
length on the stumps again, and flicked backward on the leg side, hard running brings a couple more
a bigger bumper, wide on height
full at the leg stump, forward and pushed to midwicket
back foot tap behind point and they take a quick single
yorker right on line, well dug out and gets it in the gap at cover
full again, flicked out to deep midwicket
too straight and it's flicked very fine and beats long leg around the fence
another yorker, nearly upends Buttler but he gets it out through midwicket
big shot, bowler misses his length and Buttler whacks it over long-off to bring up a fifth ODI fifty in 34 balls
back on length, yorker length, and it's dabbed into the covers for an easy single
good length on middle and leg, tucked through square leg
width outside off and guided down to third man
dropped into the covers from the crease and they run hard for a sharp single
more width to work with and this is whipped hard wide of third man who does well to save four but they get a second
forward on off stump, dropped into point and they get a quickie
straight length ball blocked in the crease
full straight delivery tapped to midwicket
leg stump, swept just behind square and run very hard for two
a wander across the stumps and back and then a dashing drive through the covers, they sprint three
back to pull, it skidded on a little and took the pad to the 45, quick single and overthrows! Just the one as mid-off eventually backs up
this time Buttler does pull, too short this length, but can only find the deep square leg
full on leg stump, this is flicked between the deep fielders on the leg side and they get two again
length on the stumps, blocked in the crease
bumper, ducked, no wide called and rightly so for me
another short ball and this is hooked into the Grandstand, such power from Buttler, great timing up the hill into the crowd, nailed it
full toss on leg stump, flicked wide of long leg and four more
cut hard but only as far as deep cover
yorker on off stump, dropped into the covers and they get a quick single

floated up on the stumps and Bopara wallops a flat sweep between deep midwicket and deep square leg, looks like it is flying to the boundary but Ashan Priyanjan leaps to his right to make a stunning one-handed take
drops short and Bopara miscues a pull down the ground, they put pressure on long-on and make it back for two
another half-tracker from Mendis and this time Bopara gets his boundary - first of this knock - slapping a pull between the two men on the rope
better length, worked off the stumps for one to midwicket
pulls across the line and gets a single towards deep midwicket
flicked out on the stumps, walks forward and punches one more to long-on - 11 off the over, England breathing hard but keeping up with a demanding rate
on the stumps, turned short on the leg side and Kula does tremendous work in dashing to his right and swivelling to through down the stumps... R-Bop was home, though
slower ball on middle stumps, closes the face and dabs a single to square leg
lovely soft hands and good hard running here, as they steal another couple towards long-on
and again! The crowd are loving this, with the field back, they're just dabbing the ball into gaps, two more to long-on
pitched up outside off and Bopara drives, Thirimanne should cut it off at mid-off but he slides past the ball
check drive down the ground, very straight and although long-on gets across, Buttler slides home to beat the throw on his chest
pushed through outside off, steers one off the outer half of the bat to short third man
flighted on off stump, played back to the bowler
comes forward and drills a single to long-on
flatter, on the stumps, manages to pull down into the ground for one more to long-on
straight delivery outside off, whips a firm pull but straight to midwicket
pushed through flat outside off, Bopara really tries to force this short, can't get his drive past cover
length ball, Buttler pulls across the line, it's in the air for a while but drops short of deep midwicket and they get a couple
waits on a delivery outside off, can't steer past point
full and wide, Buttler throws the hands through a drilled cover drive out to the sweeper
pitched up, Bopara uses the feet and drives to extra cover, Thirimanne again misfields but it doesn't cost them
pushed into the off side, again they take on Thirimanne and a direct hit would see off Buttler but the throw is wide
on the stumps, waits and paddles a single through square leg - fifty for Bopara, though the job is still far from done
flicked out and down the leg side as Bopara sweeps and misses
tossed up around off stump, walks into a punch down the ground to long-off
gets a little lucky with a thick outside edge, he'd skipped out to open up the off side, threw the bat and skewered the ball past short third man, Malinga managed to chase it down and prevent four
on the stumps, can only play this back to the bowler

goes for the slog-sweep, gets a big top edge... and Thirimanne is under it at short fine leg! Mendis shows some ticker and Bopara falls before the climax again. Tried to hit hard across the line, the ball skidded on and looped slowly towards the fielder, he's been involved a lot in the last few overs but he took it calmly
pushed through, closes the face and works one through midwicket
flicked out and skidding, takes the inside edge and runs to short fine leg, no run
slightly full outside off and Buttler batters it over extra cover, hard and flat and it dips before thumping straight into the boundary marker... given as six on the replay
six more, this one higher and even more handsome to the same part of the ground! Another full wide delivery but Kulasekara doesn't have any protection out there, big boozy cheers from the crowd
straighter line, chips it down the ground and they run hard to get two to long-on
on the stumps and pushed down the ground, just one to long-on this time
good length outside off, steers it straight to short third man and a direct hit at the bowler's end would have done for him
half-volley outside off and Buttler clangs him over the infield again! That's 20 off the over, another rapier-like blow and it takes Buttler to 98
pushed through on middle and off, Jordan can only tap it to extra cover
quicker and flat, skids on to the pads, slightly leg side
comes forward and pushes this through mid-off, single to get off strike

floated up on off stump, clips the ball firmly through midwicket for a couple, that brings him back for his maiden ODI hundred, from 61 balls. A phenomenal innings, though it will be doubly memorable if it results in an England win
full again, scuffed into the leg side for another couple
drops slightly short and wide, Buttler hammers a cut shot ... but straight to the cover fielder, though a misfield allows them to take one and get back on strike
slower ball outside off, opens the face and steers a couple past backward point
another boundary, down the ground! Malinga went very full but there's such power in the Buttler blade, he dug this out and it whistled past mid-off and away
takes the pace of, worked into the leg side, deep mdiwicket hares in but Jordan hares back for a second
slower delivery again, cross-batted down the ground but there's just a single to long-on
good length on the stumps, Jordan calmly works a single to square leg
takes the pace off and Buttler turns the wrists, clips firmly but straight to midwicket
canny bowling, full and just outside off and Jordan swings and misses, there's an appeal for caught behind but they'll settle for keeping him on strike
pitched up in the blockhole again, Jordan bunts a single to long-on
steps away, Kula pitches full outside leg... and Buttler smashes him through the covers for four! Brutal power and somehow he managed to manufacture the angle
full again, doesn't get hold of this in the same way, still gets a single into the covers
full and straight, Jordan digs a single out down the ground
ice-cool stuff from Kulasekara, pitched up again and there's only a single down the ground on off
full and wide of the stumps, Buttler swings like a lumberjack but can only squirt a single to mid-off

pitched up and swung down the ground - straight to long-on! Struck firmly but Dilshan was lurking in the deep, he takes the catch and starts whooping it up, encouraging the Sri Lankans in the ground. They're getting closer

up in the blockhole, Buttler manages to chop it down the ground and they gamble on a second, to keep Buttler facing, the throw wasn't great and Sangakkara had to leap to his right to break the wicket, missed first time and by the time he did, Buttler was home

superb yorker, dug out but only a yard or two off the strip, Malinga fetches it and Buttler is stranded! Buttler is run out after making a quite sensational hundred but it won't be enough for England... Malinga knows his way around squeaky bum time, that's for sure, he fired this in full and then was smart enough to collect and finish the job with Buttler indecisive and Tredwell already alongside him
goes full and very wide, adjudged inside the tramlines and that's the match, folks
low full toss this time, clubbed along the ground to mid-on, collected without drama... and that means Sri Lanka win by 7 runs and level the series at 2-2
